modName: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale Armor and Weapons
summary: That armor... its like nothing Ive ever seen. Like forged midnight..
descriptionHtml:
[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Description :[/b][/color]Â  This armor set has always disappointed me when I finally get it in game, just didn't seem all that thief like being so shiny and bright..

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Lossless Versions :[/b][/color] If your system can handle it I really do recommend these uncompressed high color depth versions since normal compression adds a lot of green / magenta artifacts on dark textures :/

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Optional Files :[/b][/color] I'v never really been a fan of the cape, and I honestly have no idea why thieves armor would have glowing eyes so I have added files to remove both of these, might be a personal taste thing.. just extract either of these over / install after the main mod and update.

[color=Lightsteelblue][b]Installation :[/b][/color] You can just extract to your data folder / install using a mod manager as normal.

[b][color=Lightsteelblue][b]Screenshots :[/b][/color] [/b]I use an edited [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30936/?/]RealVision Nova ENB[/url] with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?/]Enhanced Lights And FX[/url], alongside hundreds of other mods :P


[center][b](: More Spooky Edits :)[/b]
[b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57178/?]
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63709/?]Darker Stalhrim Armor and Weapons[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63272/?]Darker Staffs[/url]
[/b][b][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58274/]Darker Auriels Bow[/url]
[/b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63034/]Darker Clothes[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58073/]Darker DragonScale Armor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57956/]Circlets, Amulets and Rings[/url][/b]
[b][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57880/?]Brighter Bones and Skeletons[/url]
[/b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/edit/?id=57794]Darker Dawnguard Armors and Weapons[/url]
[/b][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57639/?]Darker Ebony Weapons[/url]
[/b][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57178/?]Darker Robes[/url][/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55725/?]Darker Dark Brotherhood Shrouded Armor and Robes[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56654/?]Darker Thieves Guild Armor[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56610/?]
Darker Jester Clothes[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56587/?]Darker Mehrunes Razor[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55809/]Reworked Vanilla Female Shrouded Armor Texture Fix[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54816/?]Darker Vampire Armor[/url]

files.name: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale Armor Update
files.fileName: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale Armor Update-63805-0-2.7z
files.changelogHtml:
Increased the male torso environment map scale from 0.2 to 1 (missed that, oops), and increased the overall reflectivity of the torso / glove env maps.

Set the emission color of the hoods to black so they should now match properly in all lighting environments.

Added reflections to the boots and the no glowing eyes hood (can't mix glow and environment I don't think)

files.name: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale AIO (Lossless)
files.fileName: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale AIO (Lossless)-63805-0-3.7z
files.changelogHtml:
Increased the overall reflectivity of the armor, while lowering it for the arm bandages and legs.

Created a new reflection cubemap for the armor using spacescape in hopes that I could get a more "forged midnight" look.. don't think I succeeded but I quite like the shiny shiny now :)

Decreased the specularity for the armor, especially in the bandages and legs.

tried to match the bandages on body armor and gloves a bit better.

Discovered I'm a dummy and I CAN have a reflective hood alongside the glowing eyes since they are seperate meshes :)

Darkened the bow texture some more

Changed both sword and bow objects to use their own reflection cubemap since the new armor one was a bit too detailed and didn't look that nie on them.

Ditched the NotSoDark version for now since I don't like the look with the new edits and refmap etc.

Updated Alurict compatability mesh to use it's own reflection map since I reduced the reflectivity around the eyes of the face mask for the main mod so it would blend in a little better to the dark eyes. I also changed the mesh to use the male version of the refmap instead of female.. woops :)

Added compatability meshes for Lord Haun's maskless hood so they match up a bit nicer with the rest of my edits.

files.name: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale Armor -  Lord Haun Maskless Edit
files.fileName: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale Armor -  Lord Haun Maskless Edit-63805-0-3.7z
files.changelogHtml:
Increased the overall reflectivity of the armor, while lowering it for the arm bandages and legs.

Created a new reflection cubemap for the armor using spacescape in hopes that I could get a more "forged midnight" look.. don't think I succeeded but I quite like the shiny shiny now :)

Decreased the specularity for the armor, especially in the bandages and legs.

tried to match the bandages on body armor and gloves a bit better.

Discovered I'm a dummy and I CAN have a reflective hood alongside the glowing eyes since they are seperate meshes :)

Darkened the bow texture some more

Changed both sword and bow objects to use their own reflection cubemap since the new armor one was a bit too detailed and didn't look that nie on them.

Ditched the NotSoDark version for now since I don't like the look with the new edits and refmap etc.

Updated Alurict compatability mesh to use it's own reflection map since I reduced the reflectivity around the eyes of the face mask for the main mod so it would blend in a little better to the dark eyes. I also changed the mesh to use the male version of the refmap instead of female.. woops :)

Added compatability meshes for Lord Haun's maskless hood so they match up a bit nicer with the rest of my edits.

files.name: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale Refmap Update
files.fileName: Spooky Edits - Darker Nightingale Refmap Update-63805-0-4.7z
